request.description:
# Voice Route Configuration

## POST /voice/routes

Creates a new voice routing configuration for handling calls to your phone numbers.

### Request

#### Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_token}

 ```

#### Body Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `RouteName` | string | Yes | Descriptive name for this voice route |
| `RouteType` | string | Yes | Type of routing. Valid values: `Trunk`, `URL`, `Forward` |
| `VoiceUrl` | string | Conditional | Webhook URL that will receive voice events (required for `URL` route type) |
| `VoiceUrlMethod` | string | Conditional | HTTP method for the webhook (required for `URL` route type) |
| `VocieAuthenticationType` | string | No | Authentication type for the webhook (e.g., `Basic`, `Bearer`) |
| `VoiceUsername` | string | Conditional | Username for webhook authentication |
| `VoicePasswordToken` | string | Conditional | Password or token for webhook authentication |
| `CallbackVoiceUrl` | string | No | URL for receiving call status callbacks |
| `CallbackVoiceUrlMethod` | string | No | HTTP method for the callback URL |
| `TrunkIp1` | string | Conditional | Primary SIP trunk IP address (required for `Trunk` route type) |
| `TrunkIp2` | string | No | Backup SIP trunk IP address |
| `TrunkPort1` | string | Conditional | Primary SIP trunk port (required for `Trunk` route type) |
| `TrunkPort2` | string | No | Backup SIP trunk port |
| `TrunkTransport1` | string | Conditional | Primary transport protocol (e.g., `UDP`, `TCP`) (required for `Trunk` route type) |
| `TrunkTransport2` | string | No | Backup transport protocol |
| `TrunkUri1` | string | Conditional | Primary SIP URI (required for `Trunk` route type) |
| `TrunkUri2` | string | No | Backup SIP URI |
| `TrunkEnabled1` | boolean | Conditional | Whether primary trunk is active (required for `Trunk` route type) |
| `TrunkEnabled2` | boolean | No | Whether backup trunk is active |
| `Trunk1Priortiy` | integer | No | Priority value for primary trunk (lower value = higher priority) |
| `Trunk1Weight` | integer | No | Weight value for primary trunk (load balancing) |
| `Trunk2Priortiy` | integer | No | Priority value for backup trunk |
| `Trunk2Weight` | integer | No | Weight value for backup trunk |
| `HeaderManipulation` | string | No | Header manipulation identifier |
| `EnableSipRefer` | boolean | No | Whether SIP REFER is enabled |
| `TransferCallerId` | string | No | Caller ID behavior during transfers (e.g., `Transferee/Transferor`) |
| `SymmetricRtp` | boolean | No | Whether symmetric RTP is enabled |
| `EnableTrpSecureTrunk` | boolean | No | Whether TRP secure trunk is enabled |
| `EnablePstnTransfer` | boolean | No | Whether PSTN transfers are allowed |
| `IpWhitelist` | array | No | List of whitelisted IP addresses |
| `IpWhitelist[].IpAddress` | string | Yes (if in array) | IP address to whitelist |
| `CnamLookup` | boolean | No | Whether CNAM lookup is enabled |
| `TerminationUriSubdomain` | string | No | Subdomain for termination URIs |
| `EnableCallStreaming` | boolean | No | Whether call streaming is enabled |
| `WssUri` | string | No | WebSocket Secure URI for call streaming |
| `RouteEnabled` | boolean | No | Whether this route is active |

### Sample Request

``` json
{
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "VoiceUrl": "https://domain.com",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
    "VocieAuthenticationType": "Basic",
    "VoiceUsername": "admin",
    "VoicePasswordToken": "passwordORbearerToken",
    "CallbackVoiceUrl": "https://apiendpoint.com",
    "CallbackVoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkPort2": "5060",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "TrunkEnabled2": false,
    "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
    "Trunk1Weight": 10,
    "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
    "Trunk2Weight": 20,
    "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
    "EnableSipRefer": true,
    "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
    "SymmetricRtp": true,
    "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
    "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
    "IpWhitelist": [{"IpAddress": "20.20.10.10"}, {"IpAddress": "20.20.10.20"}],
    "CnamLookup": true,
    "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
    "EnableCallStreaming": true,
    "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
    "RouteEnabled": true
}

 ```

### Responses

#### 200 OK: Success

Returns the created voice route with its unique identifier.

``` json
{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb",
    "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j",
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "VoiceUrl": "https://domain.com",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkPort2": "5060",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "TrunkEnabled2": false,
    "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
    "Trunk1Weight": 10,
    "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
    "Trunk2Weight": 20,
    "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
    "EnableSipRefer": true,
    "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
    "SymmetricRtp": true,
    "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
    "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
    "CnamLookup": true,
    "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
    "EnableCallStreaming": true,
    "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
    "IpWhiteList": []
}

 ```

##### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `CallRouteId` | string | Unique identifier for the created voice route (format: CRID-xxx) |
| `AccountId` | string | Your account identifier |
| Other fields | various | Mirror the request parameters with any system-applied defaults |

#### 400 Bad Request: Validation Error

``` json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1",
    "Title": "One or more validation errors occurred.",
    "Status": 400,
    "Errors": {
        "$.RouteType": ["Route type must be one of: Trunk, URL, Forward"]
    },
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}

 ```

#### 401 Unauthorized: Authentication Error

``` json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1",
    "Title": "Unauthorized",
    "Status": 401,
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}

 ```

### Usage Notes

- The created `CallRouteId` is required when provisioning or updating phone numbers to enable voice capabilities.
    
- Required parameters depend on the `RouteType` chosen:
    
    - `Trunk`: Requires trunk configuration parameters like IP addresses, ports, and transport protocols
        
    - `URL`: Requires webhook configuration parameters like URL and method
        
    - `Forward`: Requires destination number for call forwarding
        
- For SIP trunk configurations, you can provide primary and backup trunk settings for redundancy.
    
- The `IpWhitelist` can be used to restrict which IP addresses are allowed to connect to your voice services.
    
- When setting up Basic authentication, both `VoiceUsername` and `VoicePasswordToken` are required.
    
- For {{vault:bearer-token}}, only `VoicePasswordToken` is needed (containing the Bearer token).
    
- Priority and weight values are used for load balancing between primary and backup trunks.
    
- The `RouteEnabled` parameter allows you to create routes in a disabled state before testing and enabling them.
    
- Callback URLs are used to receive status updates about calls, such as call completion or failure.
    

### Try It

```
curl -X POST "https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/voice/routes" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -d '{
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "RouteEnabled": true
}'

 ```

request.description:
# Update Voice Route

## POST /voice/routes/update

Updates an existing voice routing configuration with new settings.

### Request

#### Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_token}

 ```

#### Body Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `CallRouteId` | string | Yes | Unique identifier of the voice route to update |
| `RouteName` | string | No | New name for the voice route |
| `RouteType` | string | No | Type of routing. Valid values: `Trunk`, `URL`, `Forward` |
| `VoiceUrl` | string | No | Webhook URL that will receive voice events |
| `VoiceUrlMethod` | string | No | HTTP method for the webhook |
| `VocieAuthenticationType` | string | No | Authentication type for the webhook |
| `VoiceUsername` | string | No | Username for webhook authentication |
| `VoicePasswordToken` | string | No | Password or token for webhook authentication |
| `CallbackVoiceUrl` | string | No | URL for receiving call status callbacks |
| `CallbackVoiceUrlMethod` | string | No | HTTP method for the callback URL |
| `TrunkIp1` | string | No | Primary SIP trunk IP address |
| `TrunkIp2` | string | No | Backup SIP trunk IP address |
| `TrunkPort1` | string | No | Primary SIP trunk port |
| `TrunkPort2` | string | No | Backup SIP trunk port |
| `TrunkTransport1` | string | No | Primary transport protocol (e.g., `UDP`, `TCP`) |
| `TrunkTransport2` | string | No | Backup transport protocol |
| `TrunkUri1` | string | No | Primary SIP URI |
| `TrunkUri2` | string | No | Backup SIP URI |
| `TrunkEnabled1` | boolean | No | Whether primary trunk is active |
| `TrunkEnabled2` | boolean | No | Whether backup trunk is active |
| `Trunk1Priortiy` | integer | No | Priority value for primary trunk |
| `Trunk1Weight` | integer | No | Weight value for primary trunk |
| `Trunk2Priortiy` | integer | No | Priority value for backup trunk |
| `Trunk2Weight` | integer | No | Weight value for backup trunk |
| `HeaderManipulation` | string | No | Header manipulation identifier |
| `EnableSipRefer` | boolean | No | Whether SIP REFER is enabled |
| `TransferCallerId` | string | No | Caller ID behavior during transfers |
| `SymmetricRtp` | boolean | No | Whether symmetric RTP is enabled |
| `EnableTrpSecureTrunk` | boolean | No | Whether TRP secure trunk is enabled |
| `EnablePstnTransfer` | boolean | No | Whether PSTN transfers are allowed |
| `IpWhitelist` | array | No | List of whitelisted IP addresses |
| `IpWhitelist[].IpAddress` | string | Yes (if in array) | IP address to whitelist |
| `CnamLookup` | boolean | No | Whether CNAM lookup is enabled |
| `TerminationUriSubdomain` | string | No | Subdomain for termination URIs |
| `EnableCallStreaming` | boolean | No | Whether call streaming is enabled |
| `WssUri` | string | No | WebSocket Secure URI for call streaming |
| `RouteEnabled` | boolean | No | Whether this route is active |

### Sample Request

``` json
{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-993804Ar09099",
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "VoiceUrl": "https://domain.com",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "GET",
    "VocieAuthenticationType": "Basic",
    "VoiceUsername": "admin",
    "VoicePasswordToken": "passwordORbearerToken",
    "CallbackVoiceUrl": "https://apiendpoint.com",
    "CallbackVoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkPort2": "5060",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "TrunkEnabled2": false,
    "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
    "Trunk1Weight": 10,
    "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
    "Trunk2Weight": 20,
    "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
    "EnableSipRefer": true,
    "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
    "SymmetricRtp": true,
    "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
    "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
    "IpWhitelist": [{"IpAddress": "20.20.10.10"}, {"IpAddress": "20.20.10.20"}],
    "CnamLookup": true,
    "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
    "EnableCallStreaming": true,
    "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
    "RouteEnabled": true
}

 ```

### Responses

#### 200 OK: Success

Returns the updated voice route configuration.

``` json
{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb",
    "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j",
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "VoiceUrl": "https://domain.com",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "GET",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkPort2": "5060",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "TrunkEnabled2": false,
    "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
    "Trunk1Weight": 10,
    "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
    "Trunk2Weight": 20,
    "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
    "EnableSipRefer": true,
    "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
    "SymmetricRtp": true,
    "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
    "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
    "CnamLookup": true,
    "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
    "EnableCallStreaming": true,
    "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
    "IpWhiteList": []
}

 ```

##### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `CallRouteId` | string | Unique identifier of the voice route |
| `AccountId` | string | Your account identifier |
| Other fields | various | Reflect the updated configuration with any system-applied defaults |

#### 404 Not Found: Route Not Found

``` json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4",
    "Title": "Not Found",
    "Status": 404,
    "Detail": "Voice route with ID 'CRID-993804Ar09099' was not found.",
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}

 ```

#### 400 Bad Request: Validation Error

``` json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1",
    "Title": "One or more validation errors occurred.",
    "Status": 400,
    "Errors": {
        "$.RouteType": ["Route type must be one of: Trunk, URL, Forward"]
    },
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}

 ```

#### 401 Unauthorized: Authentication Error

``` json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1",
    "Title": "Unauthorized",
    "Status": 401,
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}

 ```

### Usage Notes

- Only include the parameters you want to update in the request body.
    
- The `CallRouteId` is required to identify which route to update.
    
- To change the route type (e.g., from `Trunk` to `URL`), ensure you provide all required parameters for the new route type.
    
- Any phone numbers currently using this route will automatically use the updated configuration.
    
- You can temporarily disable a route by setting `RouteEnabled` to `false`.
    
- After updating, it may take a few moments for the changes to propagate through the system.
    
- When updating SIP trunk settings, consider whether active calls might be affected.
    
- If you're changing authentication settings, ensure your systems are updated to use the new credentials.
    
- For security-critical changes (like IP whitelists), verify the configuration is correct before enabling the route.
    
- When changing webhook URLs, make sure the new endpoints are properly set up to handle incoming requests.
    

### Try It

```
curl -X POST "https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/voice/routes/update" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -d '{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-993804Ar09099",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "GET",
    "RouteEnabled": true
}'

 ```

request.description:
# Get Voice Route Details

## GET /voice/routes

Retrieves the detailed configuration of a specific voice route.

### Request

#### Headers

```
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_token}
```

#### Query Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `CallRouteId` | string | Yes | Unique identifier of the voice route to retrieve |

### Sample Request

```
GET https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/voice/routes?CallRouteId=CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb
```

### Responses

#### 200 OK: Success

Returns the detailed configuration of the specified voice route.

```json
{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb",
    "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j",
    "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
    "RouteType": "Trunk",
    "VoiceUrl": "https://domain.com",
    "VoiceUrlMethod": "GET",
    "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
    "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
    "TrunkPort1": "5061",
    "TrunkPort2": "5060",
    "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
    "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
    "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
    "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
    "TrunkEnabled1": true,
    "TrunkEnabled2": false,
    "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
    "Trunk1Weight": 10,
    "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
    "Trunk2Weight": 20,
    "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
    "EnableSipRefer": true,
    "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
    "SymmetricRtp": true,
    "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
    "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
    "CnamLookup": true,
    "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
    "EnableCallStreaming": true,
    "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
    "IpWhiteList": []
}
```

##### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `CallRouteId` | string | Unique identifier of the voice route |
| `AccountId` | string | Your account identifier |
| `RouteName` | string | Name of the voice route |
| `RouteType` | string | Type of routing (Trunk, URL, Forward) |
| `VoiceUrl` | string | Webhook URL that receives voice events |
| `VoiceUrlMethod` | string | HTTP method for the webhook URL |
| `TrunkIp1` | string | Primary SIP trunk IP address |
| `TrunkIp2` | string | Backup SIP trunk IP address |
| `TrunkPort1` | string | Primary SIP trunk port |
| `TrunkPort2` | string | Backup SIP trunk port |
| `TrunkTransport1` | string | Primary transport protocol |
| `TrunkTransport2` | string | Backup transport protocol |
| `TrunkUri1` | string | Primary SIP URI |
| `TrunkUri2` | string | Backup SIP URI |
| `TrunkEnabled1` | boolean | Whether primary trunk is active |
| `TrunkEnabled2` | boolean | Whether backup trunk is active |
| `Trunk1Priortiy` | integer | Priority value for primary trunk |
| `Trunk1Weight` | integer | Weight value for primary trunk |
| `Trunk2Priortiy` | integer | Priority value for backup trunk |
| `Trunk2Weight` | integer | Weight value for backup trunk |
| `HeaderManipulation` | string | Header manipulation identifier |
| `EnableSipRefer` | boolean | Whether SIP REFER is enabled |
| `TransferCallerId` | string | Caller ID behavior during transfers |
| `SymmetricRtp` | boolean | Whether symmetric RTP is enabled |
| `EnableTrpSecureTrunk` | boolean | Whether TRP secure trunk is enabled |
| `EnablePstnTransfer` | boolean | Whether PSTN transfers are allowed |
| `CnamLookup` | boolean | Whether CNAM lookup is enabled |
| `TerminationUriSubdomain` | string | Subdomain for termination URIs |
| `EnableCallStreaming` | boolean | Whether call streaming is enabled |
| `WssUri` | string | WebSocket Secure URI for call streaming |
| `IpWhiteList` | array | List of whitelisted IP addresses |

#### 404 Not Found: Route Not Found

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4",
    "Title": "Not Found",
    "Status": 404,
    "Detail": "Voice route with ID 'CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb' was not found.",
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

#### 401 Unauthorized: Authentication Error

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1",
    "Title": "Unauthorized",
    "Status": 401,
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

### Usage Notes

- Use this endpoint to verify the current configuration of a voice route.
- The `CallRouteId` parameter is case-sensitive and must match exactly.
- For security reasons, authentication credentials may be partially masked in the response.
- You can retrieve a list of all your voice routes using the `/account/voice/routes` endpoint.
- This endpoint is useful for confirming that a previous update operation completed successfully.
- The response will include all parameters relevant to the route type, but some fields may be null or absent if not applicable.
- Use this information to troubleshoot voice routing issues or to plan configuration changes.
- The `IpWhiteList` shows which IP addresses are allowed to connect to your voice services.
- Check the `TrunkEnabled1` and `TrunkEnabled2` fields to confirm whether your trunks are active.

### Try It

```
curl -X GET "https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/voice/routes?CallRouteId=CRID-509de94f-79cc-429b-a317-2102654dabbb" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN"
```

# List Account Voice Routes

## GET /account/voice/routes

Retrieves a list of all voice routes configured for your account.

### Request

#### Headers

```
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_token}
```

### Sample Request

```
GET https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/account/voice/routes
```

### Responses

#### 200 OK: Success

Returns a list of all voice routes configured in your account.

```json
{
    "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j203805880870238",
    "TotalRoutes": 2,
    "Results": [
        {
            "CallRouteStatus": "Active",
            "CallRouteId": "CRID-993804Ar09099",
            "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j203805880870238",
            "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk",
            "RouteType": "Trunk",
            "VoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
            "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
            "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
            "TrunkPort1": "5061",
            "TrunkPort2": "5060",
            "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
            "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
            "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
            "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
            "TrunkEnabled1": true,
            "TrunkEnabled2": false,
            "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
            "Trunk1Weight": 10,
            "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
            "Trunk2Weight": 20,
            "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
            "EnableSipRefer": true,
            "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
            "SymmetricRtp": true,
            "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
            "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
            "IpWhitelist": [{"IpAddress": "20.20.10.10"}, {"IpAddress": "20.20.10.20"}],
            "CnamLookup": true,
            "TerminationUriSubdomain": "client",
            "EnableCallStreaming": true,
            "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
            "RouteEnabled": true
        },
        {
            "CallRouteStatus": "Active",
            "CallRouteId": "CRID-993804Ar09093",
            "AccountId": "DID-1e8939ab-3f3c-4db1-89d7-956d80fd793j203805880870238",
            "RouteName": "Main SIP Trunk Secondary",
            "RouteType": "Trunk",
            "VoiceUrlMethod": "POST",
            "TrunkIp1": "20.87.87.87",
            "TrunkIp2": "20.87.87.86",
            "TrunkPort1": "5061",
            "TrunkPort2": "5060",
            "TrunkTransport1": "UDP",
            "TrunkTransport2": "TCP",
            "TrunkUri1": "https://pstn.joonto.com",
            "TrunkUri2": "https://pstn2.joonto.com",
            "TrunkEnabled1": true,
            "TrunkEnabled2": false,
            "Trunk1Priortiy": 10,
            "Trunk1Weight": 10,
            "Trunk2Priortiy": 20,
            "Trunk2Weight": 20,
            "HeaderManipulation": "HMI8802029",
            "EnableSipRefer": true,
            "TransferCallerId": "Transferee/Transferor",
            "SymmetricRtp": true,
            "EnableTrpSecureTrunk": true,
            "EnablePstnTransfer": true,
            "IpWhitelist": [{"IpAddress": "20.20.10.10"}, {"IpAddress": "20.20.10.20"}],
            "CnamLookup": true,

            "EnableCallStreaming": true,
            "WssUri": "wss://192.67.88.2",
            "RouteEnabled": true
        }
    ]

```

##### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `AccountId` | string | Your account identifier |
| `TotalRoutes` | integer | Total number of voice routes in your account |
| `Results` | array | List of voice route objects |

##### Voice Route Object Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `CallRouteStatus` | string | Current status of the voice route (e.g., "Active") |
| `CallRouteId` | string | Unique identifier of the voice route |
| `AccountId` | string | Your account identifier |
| `RouteName` | string | Name of the voice route |
| `RouteType` | string | Type of routing (Trunk, URL, Forward) |
| `VoiceUrlMethod` | string | HTTP method for the webhook URL (if applicable) |
| `TrunkIp1` | string | Primary SIP trunk IP address (if applicable) |
| `TrunkIp2` | string | Backup SIP trunk IP address (if applicable) |
| `TrunkPort1` | string | Primary SIP trunk port (if applicable) |
| `TrunkPort2` | string | Backup SIP trunk port (if applicable) |
| `TrunkTransport1` | string | Primary transport protocol (if applicable) |
| `TrunkTransport2` | string | Backup transport protocol (if applicable) |
| `TrunkUri1` | string | Primary SIP URI (if applicable) |
| `TrunkUri2` | string | Backup SIP URI (if applicable) |
| `TrunkEnabled1` | boolean | Whether primary trunk is active (if applicable) |
| `TrunkEnabled2` | boolean | Whether backup trunk is active (if applicable) |
| `Trunk1Priortiy` | integer | Priority value for primary trunk (if applicable) |
| `Trunk1Weight` | integer | Weight value for primary trunk (if applicable) |
| `Trunk2Priortiy` | integer | Priority value for backup trunk (if applicable) |
| `Trunk2Weight` | integer | Weight value for backup trunk (if applicable) |
| `HeaderManipulation` | string | Header manipulation identifier (if applicable) |
| `EnableSipRefer` | boolean | Whether SIP REFER is enabled (if applicable) |
| `TransferCallerId` | string | Caller ID behavior during transfers (if applicable) |
| `SymmetricRtp` | boolean | Whether symmetric RTP is enabled (if applicable) |
| `EnableTrpSecureTrunk` | boolean | Whether TRP secure trunk is enabled (if applicable) |
| `EnablePstnTransfer` | boolean | Whether PSTN transfers are allowed (if applicable) |
| `IpWhitelist` | array | List of whitelisted IP addresses (if applicable) |
| `CnamLookup` | boolean | Whether CNAM lookup is enabled (if applicable) |
| `TerminationUriSubdomain` | string | Subdomain for termination URIs (if applicable) |
| `EnableCallStreaming` | boolean | Whether call streaming is enabled (if applicable) |
| `WssUri` | string | WebSocket Secure URI for call streaming (if applicable) |
| `RouteEnabled` | boolean | Whether this route is active (if applicable) |

#### 401 Unauthorized: Authentication Error

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1",
    "Title": "Unauthorized",
    "Status": 401,
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

### Usage Notes

- Use this endpoint to view all voice routes configured in your account.
- This is useful for selecting the appropriate voice route when provisioning or updating phone numbers.
- Authentication credentials in the response may be partially masked for security reasons.
- The `CallRouteStatus` field indicates whether each route is currently active and available for use.
- You can copy a `CallRouteId` from this list to use with other endpoints like `/voice/routes` for detailed information.
- The fields displayed for each route will depend on the route type (Trunk, URL, or Forward).
- Routes with `RouteEnabled` set to `false` are configured but not actively processing calls.
- For SIP trunk routes, check the `TrunkEnabled1` and `TrunkEnabled2` values to see which trunks are actively handling calls.
- If you have many routes, consider implementing a naming convention that makes it easy to identify the purpose of each route.
- This endpoint is useful for auditing your voice routing configuration and identifying unused or duplicate routes.

### Try It

```
curl -X GET "https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/account/voice/routes" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN"
```

request.description:
# Delete Voice Route

## POST /voice/routes/delete

Permanently deletes a voice routing configuration from your account.

### Request

#### Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {your_api_token}
```

#### Body Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `CallRouteId` | string | Yes | Unique identifier of the voice route to delete |

### Sample Request

```json
{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-4dec6beb-3985-444b-8c06-8baa70dc1416"
}
```

### Responses

#### 200 OK: Success

Returns confirmation that the voice route was deleted.

```json
{
    "CallRouteStatus": "Deleted",
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-4dec6beb-3985-444b-8c06-8baa70dc1416"
}
```

##### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `CallRouteStatus` | string | Status of the operation (should be "Deleted") |
| `CallRouteId` | string | Unique identifier of the deleted voice route |

#### 404 Not Found: Route Not Found

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4",
    "Title": "Not Found",
    "Status": 404,
    "Detail": "Voice route with ID 'CRID-4dec6beb-3985-444b-8c06-8baa70dc1416' was not found.",
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

#### 400 Bad Request: Route In Use

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1",
    "Title": "Bad Request",
    "Status": 400,
    "Detail": "Cannot delete voice route as it is currently assigned to one or more phone numbers.",
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

#### 401 Unauthorized: Authentication Error

```json
{
    "Type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1",
    "Title": "Unauthorized",
    "Status": 401,
    "TraceId": "00-1234abcd5678efgh-abcdef123456-00"
}
```

### Usage Notes

- Deleting a voice route is permanent and cannot be undone.
- Before deleting a voice route, ensure it is not currently assigned to any phone numbers.
- To check which phone numbers are using a voice route, use the `/numbers/inventory` endpoint and filter by the CallRouteId.
- If you need to delete a voice route that is in use, first update those phone numbers to use a different voice route.
- Instead of deleting a route, consider updating it or disabling it by setting `RouteEnabled` to `false` if you may need it again in the future.
- After deleting a route, any references to its CallRouteId will no longer be valid.
- Deleting unused voice routes helps keep your account organized and prevents confusion when provisioning new numbers.
- For SIP trunk routes, ensure that no active calls are using the route before deletion.
- Deletion of voice routes may affect billing if there are associated costs with maintaining the route.
- If you're consolidating your voice routing, consider creating a replacement route first and testing it before deleting the old route.

### Try It

```
curl -X POST "https://api.telegent.com/v1.0/voice/routes/delete" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -d '{
    "CallRouteId": "CRID-4dec6beb-3985-444b-8c06-8baa70dc1416"
}'
```

item.description:
# Intelligent Voice Routing API Documentation

This section details the management of voice routing configurations, including SIP trunks, webhook integrations, and call handling settings.

## Key Workflow

1. **Set up a voice infrastructure**:
    - Create a Voice Route to get a `CallRouteId`
        
    - Associate this route with your phone numbers
        
    - Configure call handling based on your requirements
        
    - Manage SIP trunks, webhooks, or forwarding rules
        

## Main Endpoints

### Voice Route Management

- **Create Voice Route**: `POST /voice/routes`
    
    - Creates a new voice routing configuration
        
    - Supports multiple route types: Trunk, URL, or Forward
        
    - Returns a `CallRouteId` that can be used when provisioning or updating phone numbers
        
    - Configures SIP trunk details, webhooks, and call handling behaviors
        
- **Update Voice Route**: `POST /voice/routes/update`
    
    - Modifies an existing voice route's configuration
        
    - Requires the `CallRouteId` to identify which route to update
        
    - Can change any aspect of the route, including its type
        
- **Get Voice Route Details**: `GET /voice/routes?CallRouteID={CallRouteId}`
    
    - Retrieves the detailed configuration of a specific voice route
        
    - Useful for confirming current settings or troubleshooting
        
- **List Account Voice Routes**: `GET /account/voice/routes`
    
    - Returns all voice routes configured for your account
        
    - Provides status information and configuration details
        
    - Useful for selecting appropriate routes for phone numbers
        
- **Delete Voice Route**: `POST /voice/routes/delete`
    
    - Permanently removes a voice route configuration
        
    - Cannot delete routes currently assigned to phone numbers
        

## Route Types

The Intelligent Voice Routing API supports three primary route types, each with its own configuration requirements:

1. **Trunk Routes**: Connect to SIP trunks for voice termination
    
    - Configure primary and backup trunk servers
        
    - Set priorities and weights for load balancing
        
    - Control protocol settings (UDP, TCP, TLS)
        
    - Manage IP whitelisting and security options
        
2. **URL Routes**: Forward calls to webhook endpoints
    
    - Configure webhook URLs and methods
        
    - Set up authentication for secure webhooks
        
    - Manage callback URLs for call status updates
        
    - Control advanced call handling features
        
3. **Forward Routes**: Set up simple call forwarding
    
    - Direct calls to another destination number
        
    - Configure fallback options
        
    - Set up call screening and filtering
        

## Configuration Best Practices

1. **SIP Trunk Setup**:
    
    - Always configure backup trunks for redundancy
        
    - Use appropriate priority and weight settings for load distribution
        
    - Consider using secure transport protocols (TLS) for sensitive voice traffic
        
    - Implement IP whitelisting to restrict trunk access
        
2. **Webhook Integration**:
    
    - Use secure (HTTPS) endpoints for voice webhooks
        
    - Implement proper authentication on webhook endpoints
        
    - Configure callback URLs to receive call status updates
        
    - Ensure your webhook servers have sufficient capacity to handle call volumes
        
3. **Call Control Features**:
    
    - Configure CNAM lookup for caller ID information
        
    - Set appropriate SIP REFER behavior for call transfers
        
    - Enable or disable PSTN transfers based on your requirements
        
    - Consider call streaming options for recording or analytics
        

## Integration Workflow

1. First, create a Voice Route using `POST /voice/routes` to establish how calls will be handled
    
2. Use the returned `CallRouteId` when provisioning or updating phone numbers via the Intelligent Mobile Numbers API
    
3. Verify your voice route configuration with `GET /voice/routes` to ensure everything is set correctly
    
4. Test calling functionality with your configured phone numbers
    
5. Monitor call behavior and adjust settings as needed with `POST /voice/routes/update`
    

This API provides a comprehensive platform for building advanced voice applications, from simple call forwarding to complex SIP trunk integrations with high availability and detailed call control capabilities.
